inn1.comm: good start, on middle, flicked into the leg side, a lose throw to the keeper and all very messy as fielders dive to save overthrows
pushed gently into the leg side, Lee springs across to field and ends up in a heap as he tries to tumble and throw, all very undignified
short of a length outside off, a very loose and unconvincing swish from a man who needs a score to cement a World Cup berth
wider and left alone (92mph, 148kph). Not to the umpire's liking, a bit of a harsh call
Loye jabs down a little late, into the covers and a firm call of "no" from both ends
Loye shapes to play a heave/sweep to a ball fractionally short outside off stump and gets hit in the body. Lee follows through to give him some advice, Loye shrugs
outside off stump at 93mph (150kph) and left alone

loose, started wide and swung wider, Joyce punches that through the covers. he didn't look to have timed it at all but the ball keeps trundling and although Hussey dives and pulls it back, it had already hit the boundary marker
turned to midwicket
wide again, and this wasn't timed and it bobbles out into the covers
leg side, off Loye's pads and it bobbles very fine to Gilchrist who takes two steps across to gather
short again but also down the leg, off Loye's thigh pad and Gilchrist has to move with a little more speed to take it
Loye takes a big step forward, gets a thick inside edge onto his pad and it loops into space on the leg. A hint of inswing there
slanted across the left hander, Joyce shoulders arms
short, Joyce up on his toes and steers the ball to backward point where Clarke makes a diving stop to his right
Joyce forward and pushes to point
Joyce again has to use his height to get over that and the ball trundles towards extra cover
short, too quick for Joyce (93mph/150kph) and it's through him by the time he plays at it.
long hop, pulled convincingly in front of square on the leg, four all the way
defensive push to point
banged it and thumped with real oomph through midwicket. It went like a tracer bullet. That one was for Chappelli
fuller and a good line, pushed back up the pitch
angled across the right hander and Loye not at all interested
Loye stands upright and stays back, choosing to play it late as he opens the face and runs the ball to third man
Joyce moves forward early, it's outside off and he leaves
short of a length, Joyce plays defensively into the covers
full outside off stump, a really loose drive that ends up bobbling towards the slips
a massive swing as he tries to sweep Lee, misses by some way. You can almost hear Chappell teeing off ...
outside off at 92.8mph (149.5kph) and Loye leaves it
outside off, too wide to tempt Loye but wide enough for the umpire to signal it
Loye goes forward to defend, a little more bounce and it raps him on the bottom hand and trickles into the leg side
much better shot and a real confidence booster, full and wide and driven along the ground between cover and extra cover
another attempted sweep which Loye again misses but Lee oversteps by some way
driven, but off balance and the ball scoots to mid-on rather than through the off side
Joyce leaves one outside off
same line, with a bit more bounce, and again Joyce pulls inside the ball
Joyce plays defensively into the off side
almost a replay of the second ball, Joyce leaves outside off stump
tighter line, Joyce back and punches the ball down and into the covers
jabbed towards backward point and Clarke sprints in like an enthusiastic puppy
Loye back and across to block ... 82mph/132kph
Loye again takes a step across his stumps and pushes it to midwicket. he looked slightly off balance with both those shots
nice length, not letting Loye get forward. This one is patted to extra cover
short and an unconvincing and not timed pull, the ball positively puffs through midwicket
first-rate yorker which Loye digs out
super shot, Loye climbs on his toes and punches the ball off the back foot through the covers.
Joyce leaves one short of a length outside off
Joyce shuffles across and jabs at that one, it kept low and he missed it, even if he had edged it wouldn't have carried
Bracken's excellent line wavers, he bowls short and Joyce thumps it through wide midwicket. With seven men on the off, Bracken can't drop it short
patted into the off side
flat batted to cover
steered to the right of Clarke at backward point, third man trots in to field
short, Joyce looked to pull but didn't time it, didn't commit to hitting over the infield and Brad Hodge takes a really good catch with a full-length dive to his  left at midwicket
Bell takes a big step forward to meet the ball and blocks
outside off and left, that one had some zing in it
Bell into line and pats the ball back
a little too wide and cut through backward point, third man had some distance to go to his right and that allowed the second
Bell tries to play a Loyesque heave through midwicket and misses
full and wide, driven uppishly past a diving short extra cover, a good chase and relay field
patted with no force to Hogg at deepish cover, Bell had come for a run and would have been well out at the bowler's end had the shy at the stumps hit
played into the covers, this time with no alarms
right up there, virtual yorker length, and squeezed into the leg side
speared in outside off at 92.8mph/149.5kph, all all done so with a loud grunt
firm front-foot drive to mid-off
right on the money with Adam Gilchrist standing up to the stumps. Defended into the covers
hint of width this time and some extra bounce too - a late deflection down to third man
perfect line and length from McGrath - he's a bowler reborn after his horror story at Melbourne. So far
a flashier stroke from Loye, but still no width to work with, cover tidies up
tighter to the stumps, and defended solidly back down the pitch
excellent over, just one run from it, as this one fizzes past off stump with no stroke offered
drawn onto the front foot, defended to short cover
pushed back onto his stumps this time, but same result. Tight bowling, as the run-rate slips below 3.5 an over
width, and worked down to third man, where McGrath fields to loud and not entirely ironic cheers
drawn forward in a tight defence. Played into the covers. Steady stuff from the Aussies
good strike, up and over midwicket for a rare boundary. That was banged in too short, and sits up nicely for Loye to slap out of sight.
better length, slightly wide of off stump, but then that's the line that has done for Loye this series
good finish to the over, good line, good length, Loye comes forward and drives out to cover
excellent work from Clarke at point. Bell drives square off the back foot, but the call of "wait" is amply justified as the ball is intercepted one-handed at full stretch to Clarke's left
a fraction short, but Bell can't get his swivel-pull away
steady stuff once again from McGrath. Keeper's standing up, and Bell is cagily forward to defend
that's a great strike from Bell! Pitched on middle-and-leg and just a bit too full, and caressed firmly through long-on!
back on a better length, but McGrath's still muttering to himself about that last ball
angled into the pads, but worked no further than short midwicket. Another economical over for Australia
good first delivery. Decent pace, hint of outswing, left alone by Loye
attacking intent from Loye, who stands tall to smear that into the covers, but it's not timed
full bunger, and Loye misses out as he slaps this one to cover
way outside off stump and swinging further away
outside off again, but a tighter line and again no shot
short and spanked! That fizzed over midwicket! When he hits it, it does stay hit ...

two in two balls! A touch more orthodox this time, but the same result. Watson just losing his length at the end of that over, and he lacks the pace to get away with it on this slight pudding of a pitch
lovely ball. Slapped into Gilchrist's gloves, waiting as they were over the top of off stump
another fine take from Gilchrist as Bell aims a flashy drive but misses
extra bounce from a good length, and Bell fends that uncomfortably to gully. All along the ground though
good length and good bounce again. Gully tidies up
classy drive, but not timed
lovely over, right on the spot each time. This ball is pushed away off the front foot
handsome drive to get things back underway. Tidy field and shy from mid-off
a fraction harsh there, but Loye offered no shot so the umpire made the call
tighter and fuller, and Loye drives out to the covers
far too much width, and Loye goes down on one knee to slap fiercely past point! Top strike!
down on one knee to slog-sweep, and that's a nice strike, but straight to square leg. Good thinking but misses out
driving once again, can't beat the field
more slog-sweeping! That would have been a massive wide, but Loye fetched it from way outside off stump, and toe-ended it over midwicket
angled into the pads, Loye sizes up a flick off one leg, but can't get bat on it. Bobbles into space behind square nonetheless
good nudge off the hips from Bell, but England miss out on a second run as Hodge misfields at square leg. Neither batsman noticed ...
perfect line and length this time. Pushed respectfully back up the pitch
big scythe of the bat outside off stump, but can't bisect the cover fielders
thwack! There's Loye's signature shot, and it's flown all the way over backward square for a maximum! Fetched from outside off on one knee, and wonderfully timed!
straighter this time, and prodded out to point. Good resumption from England
good start from Bracken. Pitches middle-and-leg, angled across the right hander, Loye, who offers no shot. 82.5mph (133kph)
Loye was contemplating the sweep-slog again, but backed out at the last minute and drove into the covers instead
good line and length, no room for Loye to swing his arms as yet. Pushed out to point
there was room that time! Away he goes again, and that's four more through square leg! It's a sweepathon at the SCG!
advances down the pitch in a statement of intent, but played defensively at the last minute
good finish, but that's another productive over for England and Loye, who is advancing towards his first ODI fifty
good shot for no runs. Bell opened his shoulders and flailed that down the ground. Mid-off intercepted
good response from Watson. Better length, and Bell's best attacking stroke can't beat the covers

Mal Loye is run out. Bell steered it straight to backward point where Hayden picked the ball up and threw down the stumps at the striker's end ... Loye was not in the picture and even had Hayden missed Gilchrist would have had time to complete the run out.  The calling was indecisive and the stop-start running calamitous
Strauss back and defends
flicked to midwicket where a misfield and allows Strauss to get off the mark
firm drive to mid-on who should have done better, he dived over the ball and it pulled up a yard inside the boundary
a shout of "catch" rings round as Bell edges a drive through a gap in the gully area.
good length on off stump, defended into the covers
loose drive outside off stump, minimal footwork and Gilchrist holds an edge at chest height to his left. A good delivery which seemed to pick up some zip off the pitch
speared across the right hander and he leaves it
similar ball, again Collingwood not tempted
punched to mid-off, Hussey picks up and throws down the stumps at the non-striker's end ...the crowd gets excited, the fielders don't and the replay shows Collingwood was well in
fractionally outside off stump, defensive push
slightly wishy-washy drive, inside edge into his pads and the ball dobbles back to the bowler
again driven and not timed, the ball bobbles to mid-off
slower ball, full length, clipped to deep midwicket
good ball, just short of a length and Bell sparred at that
played a few yards into the off side, enough taken off the ball to allow a quick single as point sprinted in
steered along to ground to third man
Collingwood takes a big stride to meet the ball and whips it through midwicket. McGrath gives chase and catches up with it a couple of yards inside the boundary
Bell left that but it again picked up some pace off the wicket and Gilchrist took that on the rise
cut firmly to point where Clarke makes fielding look easy
pulled between midwicket and mid-on, Hayden chases, dives but is left clutching at air ... McGrath round from deep midwicket to mop up
left alone outside the off stump
Collingwood right behind that, defended back to the bowler
opens the face of the bat late but directs the ball right to point
tries to flick the ball into space on the leg but finds short midwicket
checked drive to mid-on who is too deep to save the one
leg side, turned fine, good running to come back for the second as Bell spotted that Bracken had to run round the ball to pick it up
driven through extra cover, Hayden had plenty of ground to cover from sweeper, a good throw and Bell has to stretch to make the third
Bell pulls his bat inside the line of a ball three or four inches outside off
pushed to point and again a moment of hesitation from Bell before he set off
clipped off his legs square on the leg side
short of a length at Collingwood's chest, he gets over it well and defends into the off side
well bowled, Lee finding a good line and Collingwood has to settle for defence
outside off at 92.5mph/149kph, left alone
leg-side wide, Gilchrist whips the bails off
too short and Collingwood angles the ball to third man
rank long hop and Bell misses a pull ... he was through the shot early and Bell looks to the heavens in frustration
cracking drive beats mid-off's dive but there's others around to tidy up
driven to mid-off
pushed into the covers
wide outside off stump, again Gilchrist takes the bails off as if that might give some protection against the umpire signalling
flicked to midwicket
full and very wide, heaved to long-on
tossed up, defended, much better line and length
turned with the spin to long leg

block and run into the off side, Hussey sprints in, picks up, twists and throws down the stumps at the striker's end and Bell is well short.  Australia's fielding coach gives it out and the third umpire agrees.  Great fielding but again a sniff of indecision in the calling
off the mark straight away for Flintoff. Pushed to midwicket, but sensibly turns down a second
full-toss, driven down the ground for a measured single
turned out to square leg, just dropped his wrists to nudge the single
shorter, and Flintoff is up on his toes, cutting that out to deep cover
fuller and faster, up to 90.3mph (145kph). Defended
thwacked, and effectively so! A fraction short of a length, and Collingwood was onto it in a flash, pulling emphatically through square leg!
good running, nudged into the leg side. Hodge had a good distance to run in from deep square, and Collingwood was easily home
pushed out to cover this time. More running for Collingwood. He's been hard worked in the past week
back of a length, Flintoff defends into the covers and looks to run but is sent back with a loud "NOO!" as point swoops
stepped back into the crease to pull - clears McGrath at midwicket by a good couple of metres
on the back foot again, turned square this time
defended with a phlegmatic nudge of the bat
big stride this time, but the same result. Measured defence
a big shout as Flintoff is stuck on the pad, but clearly going over
googly! And everyone is foxed. Flintoff is beaten, so is Gilchrist and so is Hayden at slip! A bonus for England, but well bowled by Hogg
full length and tailing in a fraction. Well dug out and pushed to midwicket
Collingwood steps across early, and Lee adjusts but too dramatically. That one is flung outside the tramlines on the off side
tighter and fuller. Defended with a straight bat and a loud "no!"
just back of a length, nurdled wide of gully, who stops well with a dive to his left, but the call is quick and the running is decisive
big cheers from the crowd as Lee takes a catch high above his head, but it's a bump ball
excellent full length, 90.5mph (145kph). Dug out and driven back down the pitch
too wide from Lee, and Flintoff uses his pace to slash outside off and give McGrath at third man a futile chase. Ironic cheers as he dives and slides over the ropes
another googly from Hogg, and Collingwood is beaten going for a cut
easy two into the leg side. Good use of the crease by Collingwood, who just nudged that round the corner
forward, and firmly driven. Straight to mid-off though
"bowling, bowling" says Gilchrist, as this one is defended into the covers
swept, and swept fine, but Lee is quick off the mark to save the second this time
loud appeal, but hugely optimistic as the batsmen cross for another extra
just a fraction too short to be dangerous, Flintoff glides that past the keeper to third man
lovely nagging length, six inches outside off. Collingwood tries to work it to leg, but no gap there
on the spot again. Collingwood is back in his crease, defending with the bat angled downwards
shorter and into the hips, turned square but without any force
Flintoff shapes to advance, but McGrath adjusts late to force a defensive push
shorter again, and dabbed to third man to complete a tidy over
big stride, and a measured drive into the covers
solidly forward and defended out to point. Squeaked appeal
groans again as Collingwood defends a touch tentatively outside off. Probing stuff
misdirected this time, speared down the leg side
flipper, but this one also goes wrong!
back on a better line, Collingwood is beaten by some sharp turn outside off
big step across the stumps, worked out to square leg
short, but straight and turning back into Flintoff. Watchfully defended
nurdled out to square leg. Good power and placement
outside off stump as per normal for McGrath. Collingwood finds the gap in the covers
shorter, and an attacking swipe from Flintoff brings third man into play. But he's safely back for the second before the throw comes in
half an appeal from McGrath, that was fuller and swung late into Flintoff's pads. Missing leg by some distance
good length once again. Defended
lovely fluid strike from Flintoff, but it flies like a bullet straight to cover
defended off a good length outside off stump
down on one knee and worked square
another googly, half-picked this time and worked away
pushed out to point. Tidy line and length, and good tempting flight
steps across his stumps once again, and works round the corner
forward with intent, but forced to hold fire on the big stroke. Good over
steady enough first up. Good line and length, and pushed back down the pitch
wide of off stump, whisked out to midwicket with a slightly mistimed drive
into position for a good-looking cover drive, but once again he hits the fielder
slower ball, angled onto the pads, Collingwood steps inside the line and nudges to square leg
and short fine leg quickly into the action as Flintoff skews a drive off the inside-edge
nurdled to leg once again. Good pace on the ball allows two as the fielder rushes in from the square-leg boundary
another edge, but safe! Clarke gives chase, after Flintoff made room to leg, and pushed wide. Not a chance
forward and finds the gap with another push
another googly - Flintoff hasn't been able to pick him yet so has a big mow instead. An under-edge bobbles away
more expert gap-picking from Collingwood. He's being run off his feet today
good flight deceives Flintoff again. Pushed into the covers
forward and that's a better-looking drive down to mid-off
good measured stroke down the ground. Flintoff biding his time
attractive strike through the covers. Swept up in the deep
full toss, but Flintoff can't pick the gap. Drilled straight to short cover
slower ball, and a good one too. Full-length and that would have been plumb lbw but for an inside-edge! Good bowling
another gentle push down the ground. Good running from Collingwood
width, and worked into the gap in the covers with a big swing of the blade. Good finish to another slightly leaky over
leaping turn outside off stump, and Collingwood dabs that high through the vacant slip. Short third man can't cut it off, so useful runs
another googly, nicely defended
a touch quicker, Flintoff read it off the pitch and placed it behind point with a heavily-timed late cut. He's not enjoying this trial by spin, but he's surviving nonetheless
shouts of "catch it!" but always safe
down on one knee, and that's slog-swept into the deep. No great timing, but another run
a touch short first-up, and that's dabbed through the vacant slip off the back foot
wider, and whacked straight to point. A forceful cut from Collingwood, showing his intent
wide of off stump again, but fuller. Driven back down the pitch and picked up in Bracken's followthrough
good use of the feet, and a scampered single into the covers
fuller and wider, Gilchrist up to the stumps. Flintoff plays with flat feet out to point
excellent over from Bracken. This one is right up to the bat, and driven down to long-off for a jogged single
good length delivery, no spin on that one, pushed down the ground
extra bounce, that might have been the top-spinner
twisting delivery outside off stump, cut wide of point
dancing feet at the crease. Played square on the off side once again
floated up into the blockhole, Hogg picks up in his followthrough
defended off the front foot
turned behind square but straight to the fielder
chopped down to third man and they take on Lee's arm - not always wise - but get home
wide long hop, Flintoff absolutely heaves that through midwicket and it races away
full, Flintoff squeezes it into the covers
Collingwood steps back, waits, and squirts it into space at midwicket
Flintoff back and defends
lovely sweep from outside off stump through square leg for his second boundary
similar shot but this time the field has been reinforced
defensively turned to square leg, Gilchrist scuttles out to field
two paces and turned round the corner to the fielder
Collingwood back and flicks to backward square leg
sweep, ballooned round the corner but nobody there so an easy one
full toss outside off stump, thumped past mid-on
full length, Flintoff stands tall and smashes that through extra cover, there's a man in the deep but he has no chance
slower ball, spotted, and patted into the covers
clipped to midwicket where Hussey fields
full toss - he was trying for the yorker - and worked up to long-on
superb reflex catch ... driven hard back at Lee, right into his hands, and he does really well to cling on to it in his follow through ... it was at a perfect height but it was travelling
back, turned to square leg who is in quickly
driven to mid-off
flicked to long-on for an ambled single
Dalrymple stretches to sweep the ball, well controlled and worked round the corner
leg-side wide
premeditated sweep, top edged but nobody near enough behind square on the leg to catch it
missed drive, Gilchrist whips off the bails but never a stumping chance
driven to extra cover who is 30 yards back, and a quick run
yorker, Dalrymple jabs down and works the ball into the covers
again up in the blockhole and Collingwood gets that up to mid-on
a rather nothing swish with zero footwork which he misses with
waist-high full toss, well worked to midwicket. Dalrymple wanted a second but Collingwood not having any of it
another good yorker which is again well played to mid -on
full toss, pulled into the leg side ... there's a man out there, although he cannot prevent the second
driven in the air over the bowler, long-on round to cover. Collingwood didn't really get hold of that
Collingwood takes two steps, Watson sees him coming and digs one in and Collingwood ends up on his haunches to avoid being hit. He stands up with a big grin on his face
thumped up the ground
slower leg cutter, Dalrymple completely foxed but it cannons off Gilchrist's knee and into the leg side allowing a bye
full toss, pulled hard at midwicket who makes a good stop but cannot stop the single
hit hard down the ground to long-off
premeditated sweep which he misses, but the ball flies off the front pad and goes down fine to third man
Dalrymple steps to leg to slash through the covers, misses, and the ball shaves the off stump
reverse sweep which catches the shoulder of the bat and ends up with backward point
well placed between cover and extra cover
with third man up, Collingwood tries to reverse sweep but the ball glances off the face of the bat and Gilchrist barely has to move
steered to backward point, always risky and had Hogg hit that would have been another run-out
blocked into the off side, Dalrymple wanted a single but Nixon was not going anywhere

Nixon almost converted that into a yorker but he squirted it to longish-on. Dalrymple turned for the second but Nixon sent him back far too late, the throw was good and Gilchrist took the bails off with Dalrymple yards from safety
pushed to leg where Ponting makes a one-handed leaping stop to massive cheers
dug in and Plunkett ducks
heaved to long-on, not timed
chipped on the bounce to midwicket
swatted to long-on, Lee in quickly to scotch thoughts of a second
Nixon dabs to point for an easy one
expansive drive from Plunkett. He missed
full toss, mistimed by Plunkett and only the one to midwicket
slow and wide, no power from Nixon as he paddles to cover
one big stride from Nixon and he hits an attempted yorker down the ground
straight drive, up and over, and Clarke, who made considerable ground from long-on, made a terrific leaping stop to save the four
hit high into space around cow corner
full toss thumped to Clarke at long-on
low full toss, worked to wide long-on
full toss, launched right down the throat of the man five yards inside the rope at cow corner. McGrath gives a wry smile and a shake of the head as his team-mates leap on him.

inn2.comm: poor start, a wide well down the leg side
and another leg-side wide ... it is swinging into the left hander but Plunkett's radar is well off
a better line, fullish and blocked to mid-off
Gilchrist blocks into the off side. More swing for Plunkett
too full and driven firmly past extra cover
a yelp of frustration from Plunkett as Hayden jabs down late, the ball shoots into the leg side for an easy one
banged in, uncontrolled top-edged hook from Gilchrist which he gets away with as it goes very fine. Mahmood was wide at long leg and so never in the frame
outside off stump, Gilchrist shapes to smack it through the covers but doesn't get hold of it and thumps it into the pitch and from there to Plunkett
loosener outside off stump, Hayden sniffily watches it pass
a fraction short, Hayden pulls off the front foot and off the toe of the bat as well
driven into the covers, Bell gets his body into line
steered into space in the off side,
bouncer which Gilchrist doesn't so much duck as nod at
decent ball, short and it seamed away from Gilchrist at 90mph (145kph)
lovely shot, too much width and he leaned into that and crashed it past extra cover who never had a chance
flicked behind square on the leg, and a no-ball as well
Hayden shapes to turn to leg, misses, and is struck in the nether regions. He's hard ... not even a grimace
pushed to short extra cover who has come in about 12-15 yards from the bat on the drive
steered to Panesar at third man
rather nonchalant/loose flip over point, high enough to be safe
Gilchrist uses one of his lives ... he was looking to guide the ball to third man, it came back, he was completely cramped and it flew off the shoulder and over slip
slower ball, Hayden falls into the trap and drills it into Collingwood at short extra cover and he holds a good low catch. He didn't have to move to the side but it was low and was travelling
well-timed on drive, Panesar at mid-on dives but it's all a bit slow and for show and he's never near it
defended back to the bowler
short, Ponting onto it in a trice and he launches it over midwicket. It plugs in the soft turf and Joyce catches the ball a yard in side the rope
pushed into space in the covers
another slower ball, a genuine edge as Gilchrist misread it but it falls a yard short of Flintoff at first slip
wide of off stump and that's a very harsh call. Swinging gently away to the slips but Ponting could have played it if he wished
he played at that one! Short of a length and climbed past the bat as Ponting went for the pull. He's pumped up

GOT HIM! That's a massive breakthrough, and it's all credit to Plunkett there. Perfect line and length, just outside off and swinging away again, Ponting pushes with hard hands, and Andrew Strauss at slip takes a fine low catch!
good start, full and swinging again. Clarke leaves alone
lovely ball. Fuller length and late nip off the seam. Climbs over the top of off stump as Clarke shoulders arms
slight overstep, but good length again
oh dear, that's a bit loose. Wide outside off. Needs to keep concentrating
better length and Clarke comes forward in a solid defence
wide outside off stump, but that one is allowed to go by. Successful over
banged in on leg stump, Gilchrist hops across to fiddle out to midwicket
pushed out to the covers off the front foot
good full length, slower ball that time, and Gilchrist was a touch fooled as it looped down to off stump. Good bowling
faster and shorter. Up beyond 80mph again and Gilchrist is late on his pull shot. A top-edge bounces down to fine leg
width this time, and Clarke has a mow but misses - 147kph that time (91 mph)
tidy finish to the over. Climbed off a good length at 91mph again, as Clarke shouldered arms
another one down the leg side. These are a bit wasteful

massive start for England! Beautiful delivery from round the wicket, tailing in late, beating a loose drive from Gilchrist and clipping the top of off stump! Perfect resumption from Plunkett, do England have the CB Series trophy within their grasp?
nice follow-up from Plunkett. Good length, late movement away from the right-hander. Defended
good bowling again. Outside off, hint of movement, left alone
dropped! That was another perfect delivery from Plunkett. Burst off the pitch with late outswing, took the shoulder, and Collingwood at second slip could only parry a salmon leap to his left!
defended watchfully. It's all happening here!
GONE! What an over! On the spot again, hint of movement, Clarke went for the drive, Nixon pouched the edge, Australia are all over the shop on a rain-juiced wicket!
solid defence. Good line and length from Mahmood
back and into line. More rain on the radar ...
banged in and wallop! Too short and Hodge stood tall to thwack that through square leg. Good batting
slower ball. Reaches Nixon on the third bounce as Hodge leaves alone
outside off stump once again. Left alone
fuller and angled into the pads. Nudged into the leg side
middle-and-leg, shaping away, pushed to midwicket
outside off stump, Hodge goes back and across to defend
clipped into the leg side - could have been a close call on the run-out, but Joyce's throw is rubbish. Well wide of the stumps and the fielder backing up. Mahmood can't cut off the overthrows
short of a length and angled across the left-hander. Hussey opts to leave alone as Nixon fields with a dive towards the slips
fuller and straighter. Defended to point with a loud "no!"
short of a length. Too short to tempt a strike, but full enough for Hussey to leave alone
clipped down to third man
short of a length but straight as a die and leaping into Nixon's gloves. Hussey withdraws his bat
in the channel outside off stump. No stroke offered again
lovely ball, pitched an inch outside off and held its line. Good leave
no stroke offered once again. Flintoff finding a good rhythm
excellent over. Tight and accurate, Hussey content to let it all fly by
short and Hodge stands tall once again to ping that through midwicket. Carbon-copy of his previous boundary!
pitch it up he did, and a big appeal! Very adjacent, but a big inside-edge. Better bowling though
wonderful shot. Over-pitched this time, and that's clobbered through the covers. Good counterattack
runs are leaking everywhere now! Too full again, and angled onto the pads. That's a classy shot that fizzes through midwicket
better line and length. Back outside off stump, and left alone
back of a length, angled into the pads. Turned into the leg side
right in the channel again. Hussey watches it sail by
That's massive! A fraction wider, Hussey - who had played no shot at his last six balls from Flintoff - took a big swish, and Strauss at a lone slip made no mistake whatsoever!
right on the money again from Flintoff. He's been colossal in the last week
a bit of excitement as Watson is squared up
bouncer! And Watson was taken completely by surprise! The ball exploded off his glove and flew into the leg side
fuller length again, and Watson can only defend to complete a wicket maiden!
forward, and driven into the covers
back of a length, Hodge goes back and picks the gap on the off side
full length again, turned to midwicket
well bowled, tight on off stump, Watson has to shoulder arms
good stuff again. Extra bounce this time outside off, and Nixon takes high above his head
slower ball, a fraction off line, and that's a firm clip into space beyond midwicket.
Watson back and across to defend
outside off stump, theatrical leave from Watson
Watson goes to leave alone but is slow pulling the bat out of the way and the ball clips it and shoots through the slips
Flintoff presses on with his line just outside off and Hodge happy to leave
short of a length at 90mph (145kph), Hodge onto his toes, back and into line
off-stump line, Hodge behind it and prods into the covers
slightly leg-sidish, Hodge turns towards midiwcket but there are men out there
short of a length outside off, left alone
textbook off drive, superbly timed and placed a couple of yards wide of extra cover who never moved
driven straighter and not timed as well, mid-off skids round to field
Watson prods and is beaten
pushed to off with a loud yell of "no"
another sublime drive, slightly squarer and it shoots to the left of extra cover, hit on the up, elbow bent. The perfectionists will be purring with delight at those two
a swish and a miss, off the pads into the leg side
good line and length, Hodge into line with a straight bat
full length, defended off the front foot
genuine edge, drops short and to the right of Strauss, the one slip, and he can only parry it to third man
short of a length outside off, no shot
same line and length, consistent bowling and all at around 89mph/143kph
blocked back to the bowler
defended again, and the rain is starting to fall
Panesar on the button after the resumption, blocked
patted into the covers for an ambled single
well-placed drive to the man sweeping on the off
short and Hodge tries to run it down to third man and misses
turned to backward square leg who is 10 yards in from the boundary
wide outside off stump, a big swish and Nixon appeals for a catch and a stumping! 0 out of 2.
patted down the pitch
blocked again
tried to glide down to third man and again missed
placed towards midwicket, "easy, Belly, easy," mumbles Nixon through his gum shield
one step and a massive drive way over long-on, ten rows back
full toss outside off, Watson looks to thump in straight, gets a thin edge and the ball trundles for four through the unprotected third man area
more air from Panesar, driven to long-on
dropped into the covers for a single
Watson aims a huge sweep, misses and it sneaks past his off stump
driven into the pitch, Panesar parries above his head when he probably should have caught it and allows the single
chopped down to third man, loose throw and a few flutters as overthrows loomed
leg side, flicked with the spin to Panesar on the 45
flowing drive right at Flintoff who stops it well at extra cover ... he's right back on the 30-yard line
big swing and a miss, leg bye as it squirts out on the leg side
driven to the sweeper
driven in the air over backward point, Strauss dives and flicks the ball back

swing outside the off stump, he misses and Nixon whips the bails off and roars an appeal ... it's off to the third umpire. The appeal looked optimistic at first sight but on replay it was very close. He just got a touch of his foot back in time but it took about six replays.
superbly-timed cut right at point. A yard either way and that would have been productive
slower ball clubbed past a flailing Flintoff at extra cover
uppish drive to Flintoff who takes it on the half volley and hurls his throw at Nixon but no run-out opportunity
full toss driven to long-on

Oh my word. That is a brilliant catch. It was wide, Watson drove it uppishly to the left of backward point and Dalrymple leapt full length and took a one-handed catch four feet off the ground. There were gasps from the crowd as that was replayed.
shaped to cut but too close and he missed
driven to long-on
leg side full toss, wonderfully taken at his feet by Nixon
driven to long-off, fielder and batsmen amble as all parties accept it's one and no more
nice shot, he waited and then smacked it square
full toss clipped to deep square leg
full toss again, almost a yorker, turned to deep midwicket
speared in at leg stump, missed but it doesn't go far enough off the pad to allow a single
shortish, Hogg back and pulls off a bottom edge into his foot, again no chance of a run
outside off stump, Hogg looks to heave that over midwicket and misses, Nixon, standing up, takes well
at last Hogg middles one, driven up to long-off
yorker length, squeezed out to midwicket. "Good bowling fella," shouts Nixon
yorker again, Hogg squirts it to backward point
Caribbeanish off drive off the back foot, not really timed and deepish extra cover makes a diving stop
Hogg steps to leg, Flintoff fires one in outside off stump on the crease and the batsman is left groping at air
driven to the sweeper
turned to backward square leg, Panesar gets to the ball, flicks it back into the feet of Ed Joyce who in turn scrambles to keep it in play. Ugly but effective
short and fast, Hogg swings at thin air
yorker, Hogg steps to leg and chops the ball into the covers
Full toss, thumped to Panesar at long-on and as a sign of the times, they don't risk one to his arm
Hodge gives himself room, doesn't time it and it bobbles to Flintoff at extra cover
full toss, smashed over cow corner and it bounces a yard inside the rope
Hogg tries to repeat the shot but Collingwood bowled that wider and he had to reach for it ... he didn't get hold of it and it looped to Flintoff at wide midwicket and he took an easy catch
short, pulled past a diving midwicket but there's a man in the deep
Lee turns that round the corner, looks for a single but is sent back
a big swat over midwicket about 20 rows back
Hodge shapes to hit another bigger hit but misses
full length, Hodge drives well but uppishly and straight to Ian Bell on the 30-yard line at extra cover. He hurls the ball into the night sky as Hodge's head sags ...
pushed back, Dalrymple sprints to his right to field
driven to the right of Bell at extra cover and he throws himself forward and makes a really good stop
full toss smacked to Bell who has to dive for a second time in as many balls to stop it
that was a real mow, which he missed by some way
speared in at Lee's legs and he is slow to get his bat down
waist-high full toss heaved over midwicket, Mahmood makes a sprawling dive on the boundary edge ...but it's in vain
full, hit straight and well for a one -bounce four. he really got hold of that
full toss, smashed to deep midwicket
hit high towards cow corner and although it hangs in the air for what seems like an eternity it drops between two incoming fielders
